name: FormattingHelper
description: A utility wrapper around Minecraft's Formatting enum that provides access to text formatting codes for colors and text modifiers.
overview: The FormattingHelper class represents standard Minecraft formatting options like colors (red, blue, green), styles (bold, italic, underline), and special effects (obfuscated, strikethrough). It is typically used with text builders and styling operations to apply consistent formatting to text elements in JSMacros scripts.

constructors.description: Creates a new FormattingHelper wrapper around a Minecraft Formatting enum.

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: The base Minecraft Formatting object to wrap.

methods.name: getColorValue
methods.description: Returns the RGB integer value of the color if this is a color formatting.

methods.name: getColorIndex
methods.description: Returns the numerical index (0-15) for color codes. Returns -1 if the formatting is a modifier.

methods.name: getName
methods.description: Returns the friendly name of the formatting (e.g., 'red', 'bold', 'obfuscated').

methods.name: getCode
methods.description: Returns the character code used with the paragraph symbol (§) for in-game text formatting.

methods.name: isColor
methods.description: Checks if the formatting represents a color (e.g., red, blue) rather than a style modifier.

methods.name: isModifier
methods.description: Checks if the formatting represents a text style modifier (e.g., bold, italic, underline).

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Returns the string representation of the helper instance.
